title: Ornaments, Frilly Bits, Hand-lettering, &c.
content:
First up. Prolific blogger [Cameron Moll](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012144212/http:/cameronmoll.com/archives/2008/05/25_resources_ornaments_fleurons/) posts a roundup of great sources for ornaments, frilly bits, ephemera, &_c_.

[
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012144212im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/istockphoto_5199256_design_elements_volume_01_3619.jpg)
](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012144212/http:/cameronmoll.com/archives/2008/05/25_resources_ornaments_fleurons/)

And, Jason, going by the Flickr username [InvisibleElement](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012144212/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/invisibleelement/), has consistenly become a favorite in my Flickr contacts for his hand lettering and illustration. Check it.

[
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012144212im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/2490608656_a89e45d12f_3727.jpg)
](http://web.archive.org/web/20081012144212/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/invisibleelement/)
author: Joe Pemberton

comments.content: That e looks sort of like one of those those cards they show you in grade school to determine whether youâ€™re colorblind.
